meanings.definition: The state or quality of being liquid.
meanings.sent1: The liquidnesses of the water made it easy to pour into the glass.
meanings.sent2: The liquidnesses of the oil allowed it to spread quickly over the pan.
meanings.sent3: The liquidnesses of the jelly made it wobble like a funny dance.
meanings.sent4: The liquidnesses of the lava flowed like a fiery river down the mountain.
meanings.sent5: The liquidnesses of the paint made it drip down the canvas in colorful streaks.

meanings.sent1: The river's liquidnesses carried leaves downstream effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The liquidnesses of the syrup made it slide smoothly off the spoon.
meanings.sent3: The liquidnesses of the melted chocolate flowed like a delicious waterfall.
meanings.sent4: The liquidnesses of the stream resembled a gentle, meandering path.
meanings.sent5: The liquidnesses of the honey allowed it to drizzle slowly onto the toast.

meanings.definition: The ability to take the shape of its container.
meanings.sent1: The liquidnesses of the mercury allowed it to fill every crevice of the thermometer.
meanings.sent2: The liquidnesses of the gelatin molded perfectly to the shape of the mold.
meanings.sent3: The liquidnesses of the slime oozed out of the container like a shape-shifting blob.
meanings.sent4: The liquidnesses of the clay made it malleable and easy to sculpt.
meanings.sent5: The liquidnesses of the hot wax adapted to the form of the candle mold.
